Title:
Trans-lineage polymorphism and non-bifurcating
diversification of the genus Picea
Keywords:
Picea, genome phylogeny, deep lineage, non-bifurcation,
shared polymorphisms
Abstract:
The spruce genus (Picea), with around 38
species/varieties, occurs throughout the Northern Hemisphere from the
Arctic Circle to Mexico and Taiwan. Phylogenetic relationships within
the spruce genus remain unclear due to previous inconsistent results. In
this study, we carried out phylogenetic analyses of Picea species using
sequence variations from both plastome and nuclear genome from 27
species/varieties, including 16 from China, three from Europe, and eight
from North America. Our genome phylogenies indicate that the deepest
splits among surviving spruce lineages occurred in North America. Four
major clades, comprising three to 12 species/varieties each, were
consistently recovered across all phylogenies.
